JAP: Oh, hello! Hi there! How are things?<PAGE>...Huh? You want to know if anything unusual is happening?
FR: Oh, bonjour#! Comment allez-vous#?<PAGE>... Euh, vous voulez savoir s'il se passe des choses étranges par ici#?
OUPS: Oh, hello! Hi there! How are things?<PAGE>...Huh? You want to know if anything unusual is happening?

JAP: Well, I have been feeling a rather strange presence whenever I visit the Divine Tree.
FR: Eh bien, je sens une présence insolite chaque fois que je m'approche de l'arbre divin.
OUPS: Well, I have been feeling a rather strange presence whenever I visit the Divine Tree.

JAP: The Divine Tree?
FR: L'arbre divin#?
OUPS: The Divine Tree?

JAP: Yes. It's a legendary tree that exists in the heart of our village.
FR: Oui, c'est l'arbre millénaire qui s'élève au cœur de notre village.
OUPS: Yes. It's a legendary tree that exists in the heart of our village.

JAP: Did you investigate the cause of this...presence?
FR: Avez-vous étudié la cause de cette... présence#?
OUPS: Did you investigate the cause of this...presence?

JAP: Uh...not really, no.
FR: Euh, non, pas vraiment.
OUPS: Uh...not really, no.

JAP: And why not?
FR: Ah bon#? Pourquoi pas#?
OUPS: And why not?

JAP: Well, we're not...we're not really supposed to go near the tree, except for prayer.
FR: Eh bien, nous... Nous ne sommes pas censés nous approcher de l'arbre divin à moins de vouloir prier.
OUPS: Well, we're not...we're not really supposed to go near the tree, except for prayer.

JAP: And why is THAT!?
FR: Pourquoi#?
OUPS: And why is THAT!?

JAP: I don't know, all right! It's just how things have always been.
FR: Je ne sais pas... C'est simplement la coutume.
OUPS: I don't know, all right! It's just how things have always been.

JAP: ...Weird.
FR: ... Bizarre.
OUPS: ...Weird.

JAP: There's something strange happening with the Divine Tree.
FR: Il y a quelque chose d'anormal chez l'arbre divin.
OUPS: There's something strange happening with the Divine Tree.

JAP: Oh, that reminds me! I have a rather interesting story for you. Would you care to hear it?
FR: Oh, j'oubliais#! J'ai une histoire intéressante à vous raconter. Voulez-vous l'écouter#?
OUPS: Oh, that reminds me! I have a rather interesting story for you. Would you care to hear it?

JAP: The weird presence has left the Divine Tree.
FR: Je ne sens plus de présence insolite près de l'arbre divin.
OUPS: The weird presence has left the Divine Tree.

JAP: And you know, it really made me think. I mean, why are we worshiping a tree!? Doesn't that seem odd?<PAGE>Sometimes I wonder why we do any of the things we do.
FR: Et vous savez, ça m'a fait réfléchir. Pourquoi rendons-nous un culte à un arbre#?Ça ne vous paraît pas curieux#?<PAGE>Je me demande parfois pourquoi nous faisons les choses telles que nous les faisons.
OUPS: And you know, it really made me think. I mean, why are we worshiping a tree!? Doesn't that seem odd?<PAGE>Sometimes I wonder why we do any of the things we do.

JAP: Oh, that reminds me! I have a rather interesting story for you. Would you care to hear it?
FR: Oh, j'oubliais#! J'ai une histoire intéressante à vous raconter. Voulez-vous l'écouter#?
OUPS: Oh, that reminds me! I have a rather interesting story for you. Would you care to hear it?

JAP: What, unusual activity? Here? ...No, I don't think so.
FR: Quelque chose d'étrange#? Ici#?... Non, je ne crois pas.
OUPS: What, unusual activity? Here? ...No, I don't think so.

JAP: But I DO have an incredible story for you! Wanna hear it?
FR: Mais j'ai une histoire incroyable à vous raconter#! Ça vous dit de l'entendre#?
OUPS: But I DO have an incredible story for you! Wanna hear it?

JAP: The key to the Shadowlord's castle? You're talking crazy talk!
FR: La clef du château du Maître des Ombres#? Mais qu'est-ce que vous racontez#?!
OUPS: The key to the Shadowlord's castle? You're talking crazy talk!

JAP: Anyway, enough of your madness. Let's talk about MY story!
FR: Assez de sottises#! Laissez-moi vous raconter MON histoire#!
OUPS: Anyway, enough of your madness. Let's talk about MY story!

JAP: We are the grass... We are the trees... We are the woods...
FR: Nous sommes l'herbe... Nous sommes les arbres... Nous sommes la forêt...
OUPS: We are the grass... We are the trees... We are the woods...

JAP: Why do we seem to encounter nothing but odd people lately?
FR: Pourquoi ne rencontrons-nous que des entités étranges ces derniers temps#?
OUPS: Why do we seem to encounter nothing but odd people lately?

JAP: You should talk, Weiss.
FR: Tu peux bien parler, Weiss#!
OUPS: You should talk, Weiss.

JAP: Pah! As if Grimiore Weiss is capable of spouting such nonsense!
FR: Pfft#! Le Grimoire Weiss ne débiterait jamais de telles sottises#!
OUPS: Pah! As if Grimiore Weiss is capable of spouting such nonsense!

JAP: Hang on. I don't think he's done.
FR: Attends, je crois qu'elle n'a pas fini.
OUPS: Hang on. I don't think he's done.

JAP: ...The dark form that governs all memories.
FR: ... L'essence sombre qui gouverne tous les souvenirs.
OUPS: ...The dark form that governs all memories.

JAP: ...May the words form themselves to your liking.
FR: ... Que les mots se construisent comme vous le désirez.
OUPS: ...May the words form themselves to your liking.

JAP: That would be nice.
FR: Euh, merci...?
OUPS: That would be nice.

JAP: Ugh...
FR: Hum...
OUPS: Ugh...

JAP: ...You let it slip through your fingers.
FR: Tu le laisserais te filer entre les doigts...?
OUPS: ...You let it slip through your fingers.

JAP: Give me a break! I have to go back to that stupid land of words!?
FR: Tu rigoles#?! Je dois retourner dans ce ridicule univers peuplé de mots#?!
OUPS: Give me a break! I have to go back to that stupid land of words!?

JAP: What in the...?
FR: Mais que...?
OUPS: What in the...?

JAP: I never realized that Shades were capable of rational thought.
FR: Je ne m'étais jamais rendu compte que les Ombres pouvaient posséder un esprit rationnel.
OUPS: I never realized that Shades were capable of rational thought.

JAP: I don't care if they can tap dance and play the fiddle.
FR: Qu'elles fassent des claquettes ou jouent du violon, je m'en fiche.
OUPS: I don't care if they can tap dance and play the fiddle.

JAP: Can't I just kill something without all this voodoo nonsense?
FR: Ce serait trop demander de pouvoir tuer un ennemi sans avoir à endurer toutes ces absurdités#?
OUPS: Can't I just kill something without all this voodoo nonsense?

JAP: With the tree defeated, we no longer have to worry about being buried in its world of letters.
FR: Puisque nous avons vaincu l'arbre, nous n'avons plus à craindre de nous faire engloutir dans son univers de lettres.
OUPS: With the tree defeated, we no longer have to worry about being buried in its world of letters.

JAP: Unless, of course, time itself begins to rewind... Hmm...
FR: À moins, bien sûr, que le temps ne s'écoule soudainement à rebours... Hum...
OUPS: Unless, of course, time itself begins to rewind... Hmm...

JAP: Black. Pure darkness. Painted over everything.
FR: Le noir... L'obscurité profonde... Elle recouvre tout.
OUPS: Black. Pure darkness. Painted over everything.

JAP: Words. Scattered here and there across the blackness.
FR: Des mots sont dispersés ici et là dans les ténèbres.
OUPS: Words. Scattered here and there across the blackness.

JAP: Kind words. Difficult words. Amorous words. All sparkling in the dark like jewels.
FR: Des mots aimables... Des mots difficiles... Des mots d'amour... Des joyaux qui scintillent dans le noir...
OUPS: Kind words. Difficult words. Amorous words. All sparkling in the dark like jewels.

JAP: The words were few now. But time was shorter.
FR: Les mots sont peu nombreux. Et le temps presse.
OUPS: The words were few now. But time was shorter.

JAP: Grabbing the words in desperation, the tree turned to the sky.
FR: Saisissant désespérément les mots, l'arbre se tourna vers le ciel.
OUPS: Grabbing the words in desperation, the tree turned to the sky.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>This is wrong,</FONT> whispered the tree in the voice of wind through the leaves. <FONT=ITALIC>This is not how it was supposed to be.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Quelque chose ne va pas,</FONT> murmura l'arbre avec la voix du vent qui souffle parmi les feuilles. <FONT=ITALIC>Ce n'est pas ce qui devait arriver.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>This is wrong,</FONT> whispered the tree in the voice of wind through the leaves. <FONT=ITALIC>This is not how it was supposed to be.</FONT>

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>...The plan has failed.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>... Le plan a échoué.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>...The plan has failed.</FONT>

JAP: Once, long ago, the tree had remembered everything about the world. This was its task. Its purpose.
FR: Jadis, l'arbre savait tout au sujet du monde. C'était sa tâche. Sa raison d'être.
OUPS: Once, long ago, the tree had remembered everything about the world. This was its task. Its purpose.

JAP: It shivered with something approaching joy as it collected the memories of mankind. <STOP>This was no accident; emotions were as much a part of the tree as root and bark.
FR: Il tressaillait presque de joie en rassemblant les souvenirs de l'Homme. <STOP>Ceci n'était pas étrange, car les émotions faisaient autant partie de l'arbre que ses racines et son écorce.
OUPS: It shivered with something approaching joy as it collected the memories of mankind. <STOP>This was no accident; emotions were as much a part of the tree as root and bark.

JAP: Memories collected like dew on the thick green leaves of the tree.
FR: Les souvenirs s'accumulaient sur ses épaisses feuilles vertes telles des perles de rosée.
OUPS: Memories collected like dew on the thick green leaves of the tree.

JAP: And once they had formed a web that spanned the entire world.
FR: Autrefois, ils avaient tissé une toile qui recouvrait le monde entier.
OUPS: And once they had formed a web that spanned the entire world.

JAP: Words collapsed into sunlight before passing through the leaves and into the pool of memory. From the pool, the words joined together to form colonies, the colonies united into whirlpools of light, and the light coalesced into stars. <STOP>Each star was like a child of the tree, and it loved them all.
FR: Décomposés par la lumière du soleil, les mots passaient à travers les feuilles et tombaient dans le bassin de la mémoire. Dans ce bassin, ils constituaient des colonies qui s'unissaient en tourbillons de lumière et cette lumière formait ensuite des étoiles. <STOP>L'arbre considérait chacune de ces étoiles comme son enfant et les chérissait toutes.
OUPS: Words collapsed into sunlight before passing through the leaves and into the pool of memory. From the pool, the words joined together to form colonies, the colonies united into whirlpools of light, and the light coalesced into stars. <STOP>Each star was like a child of the tree, and it loved them all.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>Look at my memory.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Regardez mes souvenirs...</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>Look at my memory.</FONT>

JAP: A child is here, brought low by disease. He is far too young to have suffered so.
FR: Un enfant affaibli par la maladie. Il semble être beaucoup trop jeune pour avoir autant souffert.
OUPS: A child is here, brought low by disease. He is far too young to have suffered so.

JAP: Thin beyond words, the boy's skin is a shade paler than the bleached hospital sheets upon which he lies. <STOP>His parents no longer visit him, for they cannot bear to watch him suffer. The doctors have long since surrendered his fate to the gods.
FR: La peau de son corps émacié est plus pâle encore que les draps de son lit. <STOP>Ses parents ne lui rendent plus visite, car ils ne supportent pas de le voir souffrir. Il y a longtemps que les docteurs ont remis son sort dans les mains des dieux.
OUPS: Thin beyond words, the boy's skin is a shade paler than the bleached hospital sheets upon which he lies. <STOP>His parents no longer visit him, for they cannot bear to watch him suffer. The doctors have long since surrendered his fate to the gods.

JAP: The boy, too, has abandoned hope. Strange emotions—
FR: Le garçon a lui aussi perdu espoir. Des émotions inquiétantes,
OUPS: The boy, too, has abandoned hope. Strange emotions—

JAP: weariness, hatred—swell within the dark recesses of his young heart. <STOP>He tries to reject the black terror that germinates in his body, but no amount of effort or tears can drive the invader away.
FR: la lassitude, la haine, se bousculent dans les profondeurs de son jeune cœur. <STOP>Il essaie de combattre l'horreur obscure qui germe dans son corps, mais ses piètres efforts et ses larmes ne sont pas de taille contre cet envahisseur.
OUPS: weariness, hatred—swell within the dark recesses of his young heart. <STOP>He tries to reject the black terror that germinates in his body, but no amount of effort or tears can drive the invader away.

JAP: He has long ceased to resent his parents and doctors. Once he did, but now his pain is so great that there is little room in his heart to think of others.
FR: Il n'éprouve plus de ressentiment à l'égard de ses parents et des docteurs depuis longtemps. Autrefois, il leur en voulait, mais désormais, la douleur l'accable tant qu'il n'arrive plus à se soucier des autres.
OUPS: He has long ceased to resent his parents and doctors. Once he did, but now his pain is so great that there is little room in his heart to think of others.

JAP: Only one person brings the boy comfort: a healthy young girl with tan skin and deep brown eyes.
FR: La seule personne qui sait le soulager est une jeune fille basanée aux yeux bruns.
OUPS: Only one person brings the boy comfort: a healthy young girl with tan skin and deep brown eyes.

JAP: Only one person brings the boy comfort: a healthy young girl with tan skin and deep green eyes.
FR: La seule personne qui sait le soulager est une jeune fille basanée aux yeux verts.
OUPS: Only one person brings the boy comfort: a healthy young girl with tan skin and deep green eyes.

JAP: Only one person brings the boy comfort: a healthy young girl with tan skin and deep blue eyes.
FR: La seule personne qui sait le soulager est une jeune fille basanée aux yeux bleus.
OUPS: Only one person brings the boy comfort: a healthy young girl with tan skin and deep blue eyes.

JAP: She is a beacon of brightness and light in the boy's world; her very presence is a comfort to him.
FR: Elle est le seul rayon de lumière dans le monde du garçon. L'éclat de sa présence le réconforte.
OUPS: She is a beacon of brightness and light in the boy's world; her very presence is a comfort to him.

JAP: But he is unable to look upon her face.
FR: Mais il ne peut pas la regarder.
OUPS: But he is unable to look upon her face.

JAP: Whenever they meet, the boy is filled with loathing for his own state. Soon, this loathing eats away at what joy he receives from the girl's visits.
FR: Chaque fois qu'il la rencontre, un dégoût profond pour sa situation l'envahit. Ce dégoût corrompt rapidement la joie qu'il ressent en présence de la jeune fille.
OUPS: Whenever they meet, the boy is filled with loathing for his own state. Soon, this loathing eats away at what joy he receives from the girl's visits.

JAP: The girl will stop coming. He knows this. His every waking moment is spent in fear of this day.<PAGE>
FR: Un jour, elle ne viendra plus le voir. Il le sait bien. Il passe ses journées à le craindre.
OUPS: The girl will stop coming. He knows this. His every waking moment is spent in fear of this day.<PAGE>

JAP: He thinks that if he could talk to her, if he could tell her of his feelings, that this might not be so. But this conversation never happens.
FR: Il croit que s'il pouvait lui parler, s'il pouvait seulement lui dire ce qu'il ressent, ce jour ne viendrait peut-être pas.<PAGE>Mais cette conversation n'a jamais lieu.
OUPS: He thinks that if he could talk to her, if he could tell her of his feelings, that this might not be so. But this conversation never happens.

JAP: The girl disappears.
FR: La jeune fille disparaît.
OUPS: The girl disappears.

JAP: The boy dies alone.
FR: Le garçon meurt seul.
OUPS: The boy dies alone.

JAP: The tree scoops up this memory and carefully stores it within itself. Etched upon it is a single word: Envy.
FR: L'arbre ramasse ce souvenir et l'entrepose soigneusement en son sein. Un mot y est gravé#: «#envie#».
OUPS: The tree scoops up this memory and carefully stores it within itself. Etched upon it is a single word: Envy.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>Look at my memory.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Regardez mes souvenirs...</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>Look at my memory.</FONT>

JAP: There is a female warrior.
FR: Une guerrière redoutable.
OUPS: There is a female warrior.

JAP: Her greatest enemy is a beast with red eyes that she cannot fully comprehend. When she strikes it with her sword, it turns into a pillar of salt and dies.
FR: Son plus grand ennemi est une créature aux yeux ardents qu'elle n'a jamais su comprendre. Lorsqu'elle la taillade de son épée, celle-ci se transforme en statue de sel.
OUPS: Her greatest enemy is a beast with red eyes that she cannot fully comprehend. When she strikes it with her sword, it turns into a pillar of salt and dies.

JAP: But when the white smoke clears, a new enemy rises.
FR: Cependant, une fois la poussière dissipée, une autre créature surgit…
OUPS: But when the white smoke clears, a new enemy rises.

JAP: <STOP>And another.
FR: <STOP>Et une autre...
OUPS: <STOP>And another.

JAP: <STOP>...And another.
FR: <STOP>Toujours une autre...
OUPS: <STOP>...And another.

JAP: The warrior knows that her struggle is folly, but fighting the unending stream of enemies fills her with a sense of joy and purpose.
FR: La guerrière sait bien qu'elle lutte en vain, mais combattre le flot perpétuel d'ennemis la motive et la remplit de joie.
OUPS: The warrior knows that her struggle is folly, but fighting the unending stream of enemies fills her with a sense of joy and purpose.

JAP: Somewhere deep in the warrior's drug-addled mind lies a vague memory of a daughter. <STOP>Perhaps the child exists only in her head; the dying remnants of a powerful dream. She does not know.
FR: Quelque part dans les profondeurs de son esprit abruti par la drogue se tapit le souvenir d'une enfant. <STOP>Sa fille n'existe peut-être que dans sa tête. Elle n'est sans doute que le vestige d'un rêve troublant. Elle l'ignore.
OUPS: Somewhere deep in the warrior's drug-addled mind lies a vague memory of a daughter. <STOP>Perhaps the child exists only in her head; the dying remnants of a powerful dream. She does not know.

JAP: Her friends and fellow warriors come and go. Some flee in terror. Some are eaten. <STOP>She began the fight with 23 companions, but most are gone now.
FR: Ses camarades de régiment ont tous fini par la quitter. Certains se sont enfuis, terrifiés. D'autres se sont fait dévorer. <STOP>Au début, elle avait vingt-trois compagnons, mais il ne lui en reste plus.
OUPS: Her friends and fellow warriors come and go. Some flee in terror. Some are eaten. <STOP>She began the fight with 23 companions, but most are gone now.

JAP: Her friends and fellow warriors come and go. Some flee in terror. Some are eaten. <STOP>She began the fight with 33 companions, but most are gone now.
FR: Ses camarades de régiment ont tous fini par la quitter. Certains se sont enfuis, terrifiés. D'autres se sont fait dévorer. <STOP>Au début, elle avait trente-trois compagnons, mais il ne lui en reste plus.
OUPS: Her friends and fellow warriors come and go. Some flee in terror. Some are eaten. <STOP>She began the fight with 33 companions, but most are gone now.

JAP: Her friends and fellow warriors come and go. Some flee in terror. Some are eaten. <STOP>She began the fight with 63 companions, but most are gone now.
FR: Ses camarades de régiment ont tous fini par la quitter. Certains se sont enfuis, terrifiés. D'autres se sont fait dévorer. <STOP>Au début, elle avait soixante-trois compagnons, mais il ne lui en reste plus.
OUPS: Her friends and fellow warriors come and go. Some flee in terror. Some are eaten. <STOP>She began the fight with 63 companions, but most are gone now.

JAP: The warrior's body shudders. She does not understand why at first.
FR: Le corps de la guerrière tressaillit. Elle ne sait d'abord pas pourquoi.
OUPS: The warrior's body shudders. She does not understand why at first.

JAP: By the time she hears the fierce, low sound, the arena is already enclosed in darkness. Looking up, the warrior sees a beast so large that it blots out the sky.
FR: Les ténèbres ont déjà envahi l'arène lorsqu'elle entend un grognement sourd et guttural. Levant les yeux, la guerrière aperçoit un monstre gigantesque qui obscurcit le ciel.
OUPS: By the time she hears the fierce, low sound, the arena is already enclosed in darkness. Looking up, the warrior sees a beast so large that it blots out the sky.

JAP: She is laughing. She has been doing so for as long as she can remember.
FR: Elle rit... Elle rit à en perdre haleine depuis toujours.
OUPS: She is laughing. She has been doing so for as long as she can remember.

JAP: Covered in blood and dirt, the warrior laughs. She laughs and laughs until the town that contains her daughter collapses into a pile of dust.
FR: Maculée de sang et de boue, la guerrière s'étouffe de rire. Elle rit sans pouvoir s'arrêter jusqu'à ce que la ville qui recèle sa fille soit réduite en poussière.
OUPS: Covered in blood and dirt, the warrior laughs. She laughs and laughs until the town that contains her daughter collapses into a pile of dust.

JAP: This memory has been stored for a long time. It is etched with a single word: Loss.
FR: Il y a longtemps que l'arbre a entreposé ce souvenir. Un mot y est gravé#: «#perte#».
OUPS: This memory has been stored for a long time. It is etched with a single word: Loss.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>Look at my memory.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Regardez mes souvenirs...</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>Look at my memory.</FONT>

JAP: A red dragon falls from the heavens...
FR: Un dragon écarlate descend des cieux.
OUPS: A red dragon falls from the heavens...

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>Ah, that memory has been lost. A shame. It was a favorite of mine.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Ah, j'ai perdu ce souvenir. Dommage. C'était un de mes favoris.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>Ah, that memory has been lost. A shame. It was a favorite of mine.</FONT>

JAP: After many centuries of existence, the tree saw that its carefully labeled memories were beginning to dwindle.
FR: Après des siècles, l'arbre se rendit compte que ses souvenirs, si soigneusement catalogués, diminuaient.
OUPS: After many centuries of existence, the tree saw that its carefully labeled memories were beginning to dwindle.

JAP: Once seemingly infinite, the memories now seemed ready to disappear forever.
FR: Autrefois apparemment infinis, les souvenirs semblaient désormais pouvoir disparaître à tout jamais.
OUPS: Once seemingly infinite, the memories now seemed ready to disappear forever.

JAP: The tree did not feel sadness at this; grief was an emotion beyond its comprehension.
FR: L'arbre ne s'en attrista pas. Le chagrin était une émotion qui dépassait maintenant son entendement.
OUPS: The tree did not feel sadness at this; grief was an emotion beyond its comprehension.

JAP: It did, however, have the distinct feeling that something was missing.
FR: Par contre, il eut la nette impression qu'il lui manquait quelque chose.
OUPS: It did, however, have the distinct feeling that something was missing.

JAP: The mountain of memories it had so carefully assembled had disappeared.
FR: La multitude de souvenirs qu'il avait rassemblés avec tant de précaution avait disparu.
OUPS: The mountain of memories it had so carefully assembled had disappeared.

JAP: The tree stretched its branches as far as it could, but new memories refused to flow.
FR: L'arbre étendit ses branches le plus loin possible, mais il ne put récupérer aucun nouveau souvenir.
OUPS: The tree stretched its branches as far as it could, but new memories refused to flow.

JAP: The pool of memories was a black, empty pit; a hollow place where life had once flourished.
FR: Le bassin de la mémoire n'était plus qu'un large trou béant, un espace vide où la vie avait jadis prospéré.
OUPS: The pool of memories was a black, empty pit; a hollow place where life had once flourished.

JAP: The tree had lost its purpose.
FR: L'arbre avait perdu sa raison d'être.
OUPS: The tree had lost its purpose.

JAP: There was nothing to be done but sift through the few remaining memories littering the ground under its branches.
FR: Il n'avait plus rien d'autre à faire que d'examiner le peu de souvenirs qui gisaient sur le sol sous ses branches.
OUPS: There was nothing to be done but sift through the few remaining memories littering the ground under its branches.

JAP: This is why the tree was pleased when the man and his companion entered the room.
FR: C'est pourquoi il fut ravi de voir l'homme et son compagnon entrer dans la salle.
OUPS: This is why the tree was pleased when the man and his companion entered the room.

JAP: <NIER>: Well, this place is gloomy as hell.
FR: <NIER>#: Dis donc, cet endroit est plutôt lugubre.
OUPS: <NIER>: Well, this place is gloomy as hell.

JAP: The room <NIER> had entered was almost completely empty.
FR: La pièce où se tenait <NIER> était presque vide.
OUPS: The room <NIER> had entered was almost completely empty.

JAP: All he could see were a few crystals scattered haphazardly on the ground.
FR: Il n'y avait que quelques cristaux éparpillés sur le sol.
OUPS: All he could see were a few crystals scattered haphazardly on the ground.

JAP: Picking up one of the crystals and peering into it, <NIER> suddenly saw a familiar sight.
FR: <NIER> en ramassa un et y jeta un coup d'œil. Il reconnut tout de suite la forêt des légendes.
OUPS: Picking up one of the crystals and peering into it, <NIER> suddenly saw a familiar sight.

JAP: It was the Forest of Myth—its villagers prisoners of their own dreams.
FR: Les villageois y étaient prisonniers de leurs propres rêves.
OUPS: It was the Forest of Myth—its villagers prisoners of their own dreams.

JAP: <FONT=ITALIC>I apologize,</FONT> the tree thought. <FONT=ITALIC>That is all that remains.</FONT>
FR: <FONT=ITALIC>Je suis désolé,</FONT> pensa l'arbre. <FONT=ITALIC>C'est tout ce qui reste.</FONT>
OUPS: <FONT=ITALIC>I apologize,</FONT> the tree thought. <FONT=ITALIC>That is all that remains.</FONT>

OUPS: Oh, yeah. That guy came into town selling a bunch of counterfeit merchandise. Don't know how he found buyers for that junk, but apparently he did.

JAP: Yes, I saw a child a while back.
FR: Oui, j'ai aperçu un enfant il y a quelques jours.
OUPS: Yes, I saw a child a while back.

JAP: I think he was playing over by the Divine Tree.
FR: Je crois qu'il jouait près de l'arbre divin.
OUPS: I think he was playing over by the Divine Tree.

JAP: A forest curse? Oh, come now. You know there's no such thing.
FR: La malédiction de la forêt#? Oh, voyons#! Ce n'est qu'un mythe#!
OUPS: A forest curse? Oh, come now. You know there's no such thing.

JAP: ...Though if that's what happened, then I suppose "curse" might be an appropriate thing to call it.
FR: ... M'enfin, avec ce qui est arrivé, je suppose que certains pourraient y croire.
OUPS: ...Though if that's what happened, then I suppose "curse" might be an appropriate thing to call it.

JAP: Everything seems normal here.
FR: Pour une forêt maudite, elle semble bien paisible.
OUPS: Everything seems normal here.

JAP: We appear to have hit a dead end.
FR: Hum, je ne vois pas ce qui pourrait être la cause de ces rumeurs.
OUPS: We appear to have hit a dead end.

JAP: Hold a moment. What is that on the ground?
FR: Un instant... Il y a quelque chose sur le sol.
OUPS: Hold a moment. What is that on the ground?

JAP: Just some funny-looking berries.
FR: Ce ne sont que des baies étranges.
OUPS: Just some funny-looking berries.

JAP: I'd wager those berries are poisonous.
FR: Je parie qu'elles sont vénéneuses.
OUPS: I'd wager those berries are poisonous.

JAP: Maybe, but I'm not hungry enough to find out.
FR: Peut-être, mais je ne vais pas risquer ma vie pour m'en assurer.
OUPS: Maybe, but I'm not hungry enough to find out.

JAP: You guys solve the mystery yet?
FR: Alors, vous avez découvert pourquoi les gens pensent que la forêt est maudite#?
OUPS: You guys solve the mystery yet?

JAP: No. We got nothing.
FR: Non. Nous sommes dans une impasse.
OUPS: No. We got nothing.

JAP: ...So what's with the berries?
FR: ... Alors, vous en avez profité pour cueillir des baies#?
OUPS: ...So what's with the berries?

JAP: We picked them up over by that huge tree. I thought maybe—
FR: Nous les avons ramassées près d'un arbre. Je croyais que peut-être...
OUPS: We picked them up over by that huge tree. I thought maybe—

JAP: Here, hand 'em over. I'm starving.
FR: Donne, je meurs de faim.
OUPS: Here, hand 'em over. I'm starving.

JAP: Are you mad! Those berries are clearly poisonous! Even one such as you can't hope to—
FR: Aurais-tu perdu la tête#? Ces baies sont manifestement vénéneuses#! Même une traînée comme toi ne pourrait…
OUPS: Are you mad! Those berries are clearly poisonous! Even one such as you can't hope to—

JAP: Damn, these are delicious! Gimme some more!
FR: Putain, elles sont délicieuses#! Vous en avez d'autres#?
OUPS: Damn, these are delicious! Gimme some more!

JAP: Really? Well in that case, I suppose I should try one...
FR: Vraiment#? Eh bien, dans ce cas, je suppose que je devrais y goûter moi aussi...
OUPS: Really? Well in that case, I suppose I should try one...

JAP: Ugh... Oooooh...<PAGE>I think Weiss was right about those berries... My stomach feels like somebody stuck a sword in there...
FR: Aah... Oooooh...<PAGE>Je crois que Weiss avait raison... J'ai l'impression d'avoir avalé des dizaines de dagues...
OUPS: Ugh... Oooooh...<PAGE>I think Weiss was right about those berries... My stomach feels like somebody stuck a sword in there...

JAP: Hey now, what's wrong? You look like...<PAGE>Oh no. OH NO! Don't tell me you ate one of those berries!?
FR: Oh, qu'est-ce qui ne va pas#? Vous avez l'air...<PAGE>Oh non#! Non#! Ne me dites pas que vous avez mangé une de ces baies#?!
OUPS: Hey now, what's wrong? You look like...<PAGE>Oh no. OH NO! Don't tell me you ate one of those berries!?

JAP: For the love of trees, those things are deadly! Quick! Take this antidote before you perish!
FR: Elles sont mortelles#! De grâce#! Avalez vite ce contrepoison avant qu'il ne soit trop tard#!
OUPS: For the love of trees, those things are deadly! Quick! Take this antidote before you perish!

JAP: I thought I was a goner there...
FR: J'ai vraiment cru que j'étais fichu...
OUPS: I thought I was a goner there...

JAP: What kind of an idiot are you!? Didn't you see the lumps? The unusual colors? Why, even a child would know better!
FR: Vous êtes bête ou quoi#? N'avez-vous pas remarqué leur surface rugueuse#?
OUPS: What kind of an idiot are you!? Didn't you see the lumps? The unusual colors? Why, even a child would know better!

JAP: Look, I was just trying to... Wait, did you say "child"?<PAGE> Oh, crap. I bet that kid ate one of these berries.
FR: Leur couleur étrange#? Même un enfant aurait su faire preuve de plus de bon sens#! Écoutez, je n'essayais que... Attendez, avez-vous dit un enfant#?<PAGE>Mince, je parie que le garçon du village a avalé une de ces baies.
OUPS: Look, I was just trying to... Wait, did you say "child"?<PAGE> Oh, crap. I bet that kid ate one of these berries.

JAP: It's quite possible. And if the poison is this painful to an adult, I can only imagine what it would do to a child.
FR: Cela est fort possible. Et si le poison peut causer autant de douleur chez un adulte, qui sait à quel point ce petit doit souffrir#!
OUPS: It's quite possible. And if the poison is this painful to an adult, I can only imagine what it would do to a child.

JAP: Hey, Kainé? Did you take the antidote?
FR: Dis, Kainé, as-tu pris le contrepoison#?
OUPS: Hey, Kainé? Did you take the antidote?

JAP: Don't need it.<PAGE>...God, those berries were amazing.
FR: J'en ai pas besoin.<PAGE>Ces baies étaient vraiment incroyables.
OUPS: Don't need it.<PAGE>...God, those berries were amazing.

JAP: The truly amazing thing is that your stomach is fouler than your taste in clothing!
FR: Ce qui est vraiment incroyable est le fait que ton estomac soit aussi étrange que tes goûts en matière de vêtements.
OUPS: The truly amazing thing is that your stomach is fouler than your taste in clothing!

JAP: If you had genitals, I would so chop them off right now.
FR: Bouquin, si t'avais des couilles, je te les arracherais#!
OUPS: If you had genitals, I would so chop them off right now.

JAP: <LIST=1087>Listen to your fortune.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1087>Accepter son offre.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1087>Listen to your fortune.</LIST>

JAP: <LIST=1069>Decline the offer.</LIST>
FR: <LIST=1069>Refuser son offre.</LIST>
OUPS: <LIST=1069>Decline the offer.</LIST>

JAP: I haven't had any dreams at all lately.
FR: Je ne rêve plus du tout ces derniers temps.
OUPS: I haven't had any dreams at all lately.

JAP: You know the Divine Tree? That's the great big tree we have inside the village.
FR: Connaissez-vous l'arbre divin#? C'est l'arbre gigantesque situé au fond du village.
OUPS: You know the Divine Tree? That's the great big tree we have inside the village.

JAP: How've you been lately? Me, I've been doing just great.
FR: Bonjour#! Comment allez-vous#? Moi, je me porte à merveille#!
OUPS: How've you been lately? Me, I've been doing just great.
